016
017package org.parboiled.examples.calculators;
018
019import org.parboiled.Rule;
020import org.parboiled.annotations.BuildParseTree;
021import org.parboiled.annotations.SuppressSubnodes;
022import org.parboiled.examples.calculators.CalculatorParser2.CalcNode;
023import org.parboiled.parser.BaseParser;
024import org.parboiled.support.Var;
025import org.parboiled.trees.ImmutableBinaryTreeNode;
026import org.parboiled.support.Var;
027
028/**
029 * A calculator parser building an AST representing the expression structure before performing the actual calculation.
030 * The parser value stack is used to build the AST nodes of type CalcNode.
031 */
032@BuildParseTree
033public class CalculatorParser2 extends CalculatorParser<CalcNode> {
034
035    @Override
036    public Rule InputLine() {
037        return Sequence(Expression(), BaseParser.EOI);
038    }
039
040    public Rule Expression() {
041        Var<Character> op = new Var<Character>(); // we use an action variable to hold the operator character
042        return Sequence(
043                Term(),
044                ZeroOrMore(
045                        AnyOf("+-"),
046                        op.set(matchedChar()), // set the action variable to the matched operator char
047                        Term(),
048
049                        // create an AST node for the operation that was just matched
050                        // we consume the two top stack elements and replace them with a new AST node
051                        // we use an alternative technique to the one shown in CalculatorParser1 to reverse
052                        // the order of the two top value stack elements
053                        swap() && push(new CalcNode(op.get(), pop(), pop()))
054                )
055        );
056    }
057
058    public Rule Term() {
059        Var<Character> op = new Var<Character>(); // we use an action variable to hold the operator character
060        return Sequence(
061                Factor(),
062                ZeroOrMore(
063                        AnyOf("*/"),
064                        op.set(matchedChar()), // set the action variable to the matched operator char
065                        Factor(),
066
067                        // create an AST node for the operation that was just matched
068                        // we consume the two top stack elements and replace them with a new AST node
069                        // we use an alternative technique to the one shown in CalculatorParser1 to reverse
070                        // the order of the two top value stack elements
071                        swap() && push(new CalcNode(op.get(), pop(), pop()))
072                )
073        );
074    }
075
076    public Rule Factor() {
077        return FirstOf(Number(), Parens());
078    }
079
080    public Rule Parens() {
081        return Sequence('(', Expression(), ')');
082    }
083
084    public Rule Number() {
085        return Sequence(
086                Digits(),
087
088                // parse the input text matched by the preceding "Digits" rule,
089                // convert it into an Integer and push a new AST node for it onto the value stack
090                // the action uses a default string in case it is run during error recovery (resynchronization)
091                push(new CalcNode(Integer.parseInt(matchOrDefault("0"))))
092        );
093    }
094
095    @SuppressSubnodes
096    public Rule Digits() {
097        return OneOrMore(Digit());
098    }
099
100    public Rule Digit() {
101        return CharRange('0', '9');
102    }
103
104    //****************************************************************
105
106    /**
107     * The AST node for the calculators. The type of the node is carried as a Character that can either contain
108     * an operator char or be null. In the latter case the AST node is a leaf directly containing a value.
109     */
110    public static class CalcNode extends ImmutableBinaryTreeNode<CalcNode> {
111        private int value;
112        private Character operator;
113
114        public CalcNode(int value) {
115            super(null, null);
116            this.value = value;
117        }
118
119        public CalcNode(Character operator, CalcNode left, CalcNode right) {
120            super(left, right);
121            this.operator = operator;
122        }
123
124        public int getValue() {
125            if (operator == null) return value;
126            switch (operator) {
127                case '+':
128                    return left().getValue() + right().getValue();
129                case '-':
130                    return left().getValue() - right().getValue();
131                case '*':
132                    return left().getValue() * right().getValue();
133                case '/':
134                    return left().getValue() / right().getValue();
135                default:
136                    throw new IllegalStateException();
137            }
138        }
139
140        @Override
141        public String toString() {
142            return (operator == null ? "Value " + value : "Operator '" + operator + '\'') + " | " + getValue();
143        }
144
145    }
146
147    //**************** MAIN ****************
148
149    public static void main(String[] args) {
150        main(CalculatorParser2.class);
151    }
152
153}
